intro: Nervilia kotschyi var. kotschyi, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Nervilia kotschyi var. kotschyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in specialized gardens due to its unique appearance and ecological significance.
